author: @azfamily
title: Record setting warm winter in Arizona
text: Updated: 3 hours ago| Nancy Knapp found this community at a time when she needed it most. In 2007, she moved to Mesa from a small town in Wisconsin. About five years ago, she retired from work. During that period, she lost two sisters. Then, COVID hit. Updated: 7 hours ago| It’s not just the fireworks causing the problem — it’s cars and woodburning as well. This type of air quality could increase the chances of lung disease or trigger asthma attacks. Updated: 8 hours ago| Some business owners and employees in northern Arizona say there are better solutions to fight inflation than increasing wages. Updated: 8 hours ago| Craig Ricketts was making his way to Tempe to visit his son, but because of the Lukeville checkpoint closure, he took the route to the Sasabe border, one of the most dangerous regions of the state. Updated: 12 hours ago| Something Good is sponsored by Papa Murphy’s | He says he’s spent thousands of dollars on all sorts of goods to ensure these families are able to live comfortably while they figure out the next steps.
